name: Wally
overview:
Wally is a global, smart personal finance application available for free on the iPhone. It was build specifically for people on the go that want to take control of their personal finances.

Wally gives its users a comprehensive look into their financial situation by taking their income and expenses into consideration. It uses that information and tools to give them the ability to set and meet their goals, plans or budget.

Wally takes pride in its incredible ease of use and quick ability for a user to add an expense on the go. Its built on extensive machine learning algorithms and artificial intelligence in order to adapt on its users behaviour.

Users can also scan and save their receipts with each transaction in order to avoid keeping receipts in their wallets or pockets.

Although Wally has only released the English version, its working on releasing 12 other languages in its next update. Its already available in all the currencies from around the world.

A young start-up based in Dubai, UAE, its engineers are based in Beirut, Lebanon.

Baher Al Hakim is the co-founder and brainchild of Wally, while Saeid Hejazi, also a co-founder is the CEO. Makram Saleh runs the engineering team out of Beirut, and Maya Zankoul, a published illustrator, is behind the app’s beautiful user interface. Moe Skaffi leads the machine learning and AI development.

Having raised US$ 550,000 in Seed funding, Wally is currently focused on building the right product. It averages 4.5 / 5 stars on Apple’s App Stores from around the world, has received high praises from app critics and the media alike.

Wally launched in March, 2013 at the ArabNet Conference in Beirut and won 1st place for Best Start-Up after beating other start-ups from across the region and the US. It won another start-up competition held by MAKE Business Hub for Best Start-Up in Dubai.
